name: OSPF
description: Open Shortest Path First (OSPF) is a link-state routing protocol that uses Dijkstra's SPF algorithm to calculate the shortest path. It's an IGP (Interior Gateway Protocol) commonly used in enterprise networks.
key_topics: OSPF neighbor states (Down, Init, 2-Way, ExStart, Exchange, Loading, Full)
OSPF metric calculation (cost based on bandwidth)
common_misconceptions: Many training resources incorrectly state that OSPF always elects a DR/BDR. Cisco documentation clarifies this only happens on broadcast and NBMA networks, NOT on point-to-point links
Third-party materials often oversimplify LSA types. Cisco's config guide shows that understanding when Type 3 Summary LSAs are generated at ABRs is critical for CCNA
Training books frequently confuse OSPF cost calculation. Cisco IOS uses: cost = reference bandwidth / interface bandwidth, where reference bandwidth defaults to 100 Mbps
Common error: stating that lowest Router ID becomes DR. Actually, highest OSPF priority wins; Router ID is the tiebreaker only when priorities are equal
